Here they are, the top two Mustangs in the Mustang-on-Mustang Competition. Vote for the winning Mustang NOW! 

Choose either the #66Fastback or #14ShelbyGT500.  Only votes via hashtag will be captured. Voting ends 4/7 at midnight EST.

We're down to the last four cars in our Mustang-on-Mustang competition! Will the #66Fastback beat the #CobraJet? Can the #14ShelbyGT500 pass the #NFSMustangGT in voting? You decide!

Please select only one car per pair. Only votes via hashtag will be captured. Voting ends Saturday 4/5 at midnight EST.

http://ford.to/1hOq8Y4 Timeline Photos

It’s time to pick the last two Mustang semi-finalists! Who will be the winner of the #93Cobra vs. #14ShelbyGT500 match up? Which Mustang will come out victorious when #NFSMustangGT vs. #BlueAngels face off? Your votes will decide which cars move on to the next round. 

Be sure to make your vote count and select one car per pairing. 

Only votes via hashtag will be captured. Voting ends 4/2 at midnight EST.

http://ford.to/1iirGY1 Timeline Photos

It’s a double-header today and only two Mustangs will advance to the semi-final round. We’ve got the #77CobraII vs. #66Fastback and the #ParnelliJones vs. #CobraJet – who are you voting for?
 
Be sure to make your vote count and pick one car per pairing. 
 
Only votes via hashtag will be captured.  Voting ends 3/30 at midnight EST. 

http://ford.to/1lfLiPv Timeline Photos

Start your engines! Voting for your favorite One-Of-A-Kind Mustang begins NOW. Choose from either #NFSMustangGT or #ThunderbirdsGT and #62MustangConcept or #BlueAngels. Please select only one Mustang per pairing.

Be sure to make your vote count!  Only votes via hashtag will be captured. Voting ends 3/27 at midnight EST. 
 
http://ford.to/1jTh7f8 Timeline Photos

Be sure to make your vote count!  Only votes via hashtag will be captured. Voting ends 3/24 at midnight EST. 

http://ford.to/OSQLQM Timeline Photos

Start your engines! Voting for your favorite Race Car Mustang begins NOW. Choose from either #ParnelliJones or #GrandAmBoss and #CobraJet or #MustangRTR. Select only one Mustang per pairing.

Be sure to make your vote count! Please use the Mustang hashtag EXACTLY as it appears. Only votes via hashtag will be captured.  Remember, voting ends midnight EST. 
 
http://ford.to/1f0Hvk4 Timeline Photos

Check out the 2013 Mustang Cobra Jet Concept and all of it's "tire-frying" power. Ford Unveils Twin-Turbo Cobra Jet Concept at SEMA Show A Ford Social Citizen Journalist report from the 2012 SEMA Show

A little Mustang Cobra Jet history for all of you. The Cobra Jet has been in existence since 1968, the brainchild of a Ford dealer who was into drag racing, Bob Tasca. Bob had one objective: go fast. Four decades later and we're showcasing modern muscle at SEMA! Ford Mustang Cobra Jet Gets Twin Turbos: SEMA 2012 The 2012 SEMA show is well underway, and among the various tuned and factory custom cars on the show floor, there are a few legitimate race cars. One of them is the straight-strip terrorizing Mustang Cobra Jet--now with twin turbos. Though we don't get any stats or details on the twin-turbo Cobra...

March Muscle Car Madness Winner: 1969 Ford Mustang Boss 429 It's done. We did it. Find someone around you and give them a big hug and a high-five. We've picked an ultimate Muscle Car in our March Muscle Car Madness bracket, and it's the 1969 Ford Mustang Boss 429.

With a 1970 Boss 302, a 1966 Shelby Cobra GT350, and a 1969 Ford Mustang Boss 429 still alive in Jalopnik's muscle car tournament, there's plenty of time to pick your favorite vehicle to be anointed King of the Muscle Cars!  March Muscle Car Madness: The Elite Eight We're here. The Elite Eight. Out of sixty-four amazing muscle car starters (well, sixty-three and a Prowler), we're down to eight survivors in our March Muscle Car Madness tournament, and after today, we'll have the Final Four.

Next month, Mustang and the Empire State Building are teaming up to recreating history in honor of the Mustang's 50th birthday. AskMen.com shares the details: http://ford.to/1h0NEMW Timeline Photos

No, it’s not an urban legend. In 1965, Ford’s team of automotive “surgeons” carried out Operation Mustang. The mission: Put a ’66 Mustang on the Empire State Building by disassembling the ‘stang, lifting each piece via elevators, and then assembling it back to health on the 86th floor observation deck of the world’s tallest building at the time. “It’s impossible,” many said.
